comment.body:
- User's activity feed on profile page just added recently. (using it you can see user's latest comments)
- I think i just fixed the hub detection, please update the all.js from the original site (make sure you clean the js cache by opening js console - F12 - and check disable cache on network tab)
If you clone a site the prive key is saved to data/users.json file, it's not associated with zeroid.
@Benjaminnelan: auth_privatekey used for signing user content (comments, upvotes, etc.), privatekey used for signing site content (new blog post)
I was unable to reproduce the problem, but pushed an another modification, plz try again
@tkarita: Need to add "ignore": "(merged-.*|(js|css)/(?!all.(js|css)))" to content.json to solve that error
@tkarita: 1HmJ7GadjdiQUPevaK7QXVrK4nhyCp1fSj/content.json contains: ignore: ""
@Jayofthezero: It's still bad, you should use the same ignore as the original site
There is a db rebuild button at the sidebar, you can use it anytime to generate a new ZeroMe.db from the json data files.
@Jayofthezero: It was fixed earlier today, you should update your all.js file.
@Jayofthezero: Added some more debug messages, please update and paste the js console messages (F12) into a pastebin or mail: hello@zeronet.io
@Jayofthezero: Probably browser caching issue. If you modify css/js always open the js console, check disable caching and press F5
@Jayofthezero: To change the username colors search for "saturation = 30" and change it for example to 70 and also bump to lightness = 70
Can't reproduce, do you have infinity hub running? It's causing problems since they want to be merger site and hub at once which in not a good idea.
There is a development tutorial at zeroblog, thats the best way to understad how does  it works

Multiple reasons: 
- ZeroNet does not support files larger than 1MB, 
- Tor network is not suitable to distribute large files. (half of the users connected that way)
- Also I don't think most of the most of the ppl generate any video content that worth sharing, but it's planned later.
Images/file sharing planned later, but it needs some improvements on optional files feature to make it work better.
I think it should be fine now.
@tkarita: There is "no peers it expects to publish to", every content is published to everyone
@tkarita: Totally random
@tkarita: Currently everything between @ and : is considered as username.
@Dergatt: key-rsa.pem is not important (new generated after startup), user.json is the only important file, it contains your keys.
The entries come directly from site's database, so it's not stored anywhere. Can you explain the problem?
Increased the limit, auto-delete older posts/comments feature planned later
It's happening because the query is looking for the comments and not for the post. Just added auto unfollow on post delete feature to avoid this.

It won't be "delete without any notify", but it will display a message: "You are running out of your allowed space on RedHub (38/50kb) do you want to remove your posts and comments older than 1 month?"
It could be possible to add older posts/messages as optional files (need some work: who will host these files?, what the limit on that?, etc.) but I think on a social sites really about the latest content, so it's not a problem to remove older content.

@P2P: The optional files also has drawbacks: it needs more connections and data transfer, because it's no longer "everyone has everything", so the peers constantly has to communicate between each "what files do you have?" and if someone wants to find a rare optional file, then he has to ask many peers for it. And also archiving it won't make possible to archive comments, because you don't know what files you have to ask for. 
So i'm not sure if it's worth making it more complicated, but if someone wants to run an archiving node, then it's possible by simply adding the data directory to a git repository, so you can reverse it to any state.
@tkarita: don't think so, but if you start commenting before the site is synced correctly, then it could
@P2P: Normally it should not happen: if your file is in sync, then it will wait for it. Sometimes the hub not able to sync 100% percent, so locking it until full downloaded will not work.
@P2P: Just made some modifications on ZeroMe to prevent the profile lost and in API fileWrite command (needs more testing before publish)
Thanks for reporting, its fixed now
yeah, i have the private key
Yeah it's planned, but not implemented yet.
@weakish: This is works: `"this is my code: {code}".format(**locals())` and from Python 3.6 this will also work: `f'this is my code: {code}'`

Some help:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zeronetwork.bit/?Post:92:New+version:+0.4.1#Comments
You can also change the name/sign/publish it using the sidebar (drag topright 0 button to left)

@Bashrc: You can sign/publish files from using `zeronet.py siteSign --help`, the database is using sqlite which is pretty easy to query from any language, so I think it would be easy to create a command line client for any site.
Here is simple cheatsheet: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet
Fixed (user limit was reached)
@Greate Sick: yes 40kb by default
I happy to change the address if someone willing to make a better (moderated) clone/version of it

To check your limit you have to go to your hub's page (Blue hub), open sidebar then it will be in identity address section. (I have just increased your limit)
To solve this problem there can be automatic deletion of old content or it could be possible to move them to optional files, so you will only host old content for people you follow. I'm currently working on better optional files support that could make it possible.
You can enable "Help distribute all new files" for hubs and it won't eat your storage since optional files storage is limited (10% of your free space by default)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zeronetwork.bit/?Post:96:Changelog,+November+8,+2016#Comments
@Great Sick: http://www.theverge.com/2016/11/23/13728726/telegram-anonymous-blogging-platform-telegraph
@GomZik: Https is also protect you from MITM, without it it's possible to inject malware to the content or change the text
In most of countries it's not illegal to use drugs: http://www.emcdda.europa.eu/topics/law/penalties-at-a-glance
It's required for the globe on the sidebar.
After adding  `-H "Accept: text/html"` parameter it should work.
adding `"optional": ".*(mp3|avi|etc)", ` should do that
@ks: I have just tried and it worked: Cloned ZeroBlog, added that line to content.json, copied an mp3 to the site, signed using the sidebar.
@ks: It should be compatible with re matches, but in json files to get `\` you need to write `\\`, so `"files/.+\\.mp3"`
Currently it's not possible to enable optional file downloading via cli
@ks: Yes, if it's downloaded then it's seeded.
I'm next to Gandhi :)
strange story, please keep us updated if you find any more information
@ks: Thanks, best article about it so far!
@ks: Is there any error in the JS console? (F12)
Thanks for reporting, fixed!
Using the Tor network you can get around NAT by creating hidden service
@P2P: Yeah IPv6 support is also a must-have and will be added.
Try to update to latest version, rev1884
@P2P: Probably the easiest would be distributing it with a zeronet.conf file that has that option enabled
@P2P: config.saveValue("keep_ssl_cert", "") should work btw because `"" is None` does not return True
It has lots of users, so I decided not include it as default option to create new account. (if you seed it, then it will visible in the list)
Actually I also did this before the UiPassword plugin, because less http request = faster speed load. On slower computers you can feel the difference even if the files are loaded from localhost.

@Jayofthezero: It is on my old machine (core2duo) I could feel the difference. (not to mention it's lot faster to download 1 file from the network, than 4)
Probably http/2 would help this issue, but there is no support for that yet.
It should also work without the `./`: [Click Me!](?Post/1BLueGvui1GdbtsjcKqCf4F67uKfritG49/16nArdxrSaNThNp83kL8E6NLL9WD98iUne/1488835102) and this way it won't reload the page.
@P2P: yeah it was a bug, fixed now
It's disabled due security reasons: external images would allow to track users.
Looking nice, I will check the pull request!
Yeah thanks, it's a pretty big patch, I going to check it
`--fileserver_ip 1.2.3.4 --ui_ip 1.2.3.4` should work
Yeah, you are right, it's only modified the listening socket's network address. I will check the possibility on binding outgoing connections.
Rev2054 added `--bind 1.2.3.4` optional. I was unable to test it as I don't have VPN connection, so please give some feedback if it worked for you.
@Nofishes: I'm open for suggestions, the "Please use English, you can reach other language forums at the top of this page" warning at topic creation does not seems to be working

I'm currently working on a language separated site directory where anyone can submit new addresses, so probably it will direct the traffic to other sites as well.
@Binchan: To keep the site size limit the comments older than 200 days periodically got deleted. In the next few months I'm planning to implement an archive feature that will allow users to decide if they want to download, see and serve old data or not.
I have used https://wirexapp.com/ around 1 year ago as virtual card to buy something from aliexpress and it worked well.
@P2P: Probably depends on shipping method, but free shipping (by simple mail) is around 3 weeks.
Can you please explain what you mean by "privatekey sometime will automatic missing problem" ?
It's looks like the proxy is pretty overloaded. The owner can increase it using the `--max_file_opened` argument. Other tips: https://serverfault.com/questions/20387/debian-too-many-open-files
It's working here, do you see any error in js console? (F12)
Yes, supported trackers: bittorrent http(s), bittorrent udp, custom zeronet
Thanks for the suggestion, from Rev3173 it won't ask for permission if it already has it + fixed the NoneType error
